review.des:
So wanted to like this more but the service brought the stars down.
Waited over 10 minutes to get s waiter and then another 10 for our drinks to come out. Now I get this if it's a busy Friday or Saturday but seriously on a random Wednesday?
Then had to wait for our waiter to finally come and take our order. Very nice guy but probably we were the only table he had in the back?
Food was good. Not wow fantastic but I liked the ribs and the sauces. The salmon was good not great.
Ok for every once in a while but not our favorite place.
Whiskey was great.

Came to this restaurant looking for some good bbq southern comfort food. Ordered the pulled pork with a side of cole slaw. Big disappointment. The pulled pork was so dry and bleh. It's so dry that I felt like it's gonna choke on my throat. Good thing their bbq sauces are really good..so have to kept dumping sauce on the meat to make me taste something. The cole slaw was pretty much the same..flavor was just bleh. Think the only thing that tasted good was the chips they brought out in the beginning. Overall, the staff was nice. But still messed up our leftovers, so I ended up taking home my friends food instead of my own. The restaurant vibe was okay as well.

In the three years that I've lived in Chicago I have found Chicago q to have the best barbecue I've ever tasted. I love it so much that I've introduced many friends to it. In fact every dish I have had here is excellent! The Art Smith fried chicken is my top choice but you also can't go wrong with the brisket or baby back ribs. For appetizers my go-tos are the fried green tomatoes and bacon cheddar hush puppies. For sides the macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, and honey butter cornbread are all delectable in their own  right.

Each time I walk in I am greeted by pleasant and friendly hostesses that accommodate me and my guests. The atmosphere and ambiance also help make for a pleasurable dining experience. The service has always been top notch. And you can't miss the manager Ben with his distinguished look and charm. I've often noticed how attentive and observant he is to the needs of the dining patrons. As my friends and I often say, he is "the face of Q".

And last, but not least, the dessert... All of the desserts are large and can easily be shared among several people. The carrot cake is the best I've ever tasted and the milk & cookies are one of my personal favorites.

Ordered appetizers for a small gathering at Biggs Cigar Mansion (next door). Meatballs, Mac & Cheese and Wings.  HORRIBLE.

*The meat balls were more like hard dry lump Charcoal balls..
*The "bbq" Wings were appetizing on ONE side and the other side was BURNT TO HIGH HELL..
*The Mac & Cheese was Sahara Desert Dry But edible.

It was quite embarrassing that I served this to my guests.

I've been twice recently for brunch. There's things I like and then there's things that I don't like, but there is one thing that I LOVE... that Art Smith's FRIED CHICKEN & WAFFLE!!

This is one of the best chicken and waffle dishes you'll find anywhere! The chicken is perfectly moist and crispy, it's perfection. Waffles are light & airy. Then we have this strawberry-red pepper coulis. I don't know what coulis is and you don't either; all you need to know if you put it on the waffle and delicious!

Other pros:
- Bloody Mary bar! You can seriously make your Bloody Mary a meal in itself, with bacon, cheese, meats, veggies and any other food group you can imagine. It comes with a hefty price tag, but you can definitely make it worth it!

Cons:  
- Price:  It's expensive, I know if comes with the area/territory, but I'm always shocked at how expensive things are.
- Benedict Flight: I am a chronic order-er of eggs Benedict, but I was unimpressed with this one. None of the meats hooked me, the eggs were overpowered by all the meat and the bread underneath so soggy from said meat. Personally not my favorite.

Have yourself a Bloody Mary and some Fried Chicken & Waffles and you'll leave a happy customer!

I was super excited to have Art Smith's buttermilk fried chicken and wasn't disappointed. Everyone else had bbq. Happily. Excellent food, good
service, personable servers. Oddly short tables/chairs. Knees were creaky after dinner. Get adult sized tables.

Brought a group of 8 here for a birthday celebration: food and service were excellent! The burnt ends were flavorful and juicy to start the meal. The flight was a great mix of their meats and their mashed potatoes had skins on - very creamy! We were in between the sweet and savory cornbread - we chose the sweet and our sever threw in the savory for free! Cake for dessert came in large proportions: very rich and a great way to end the meal. Best barbecue place I've tried in Chicago!
I dined there recently with a friend. The ambience was nice, the food was great, and service was excellent.

Excellent food and service! The beef brisket and fried chicken are both amazing! We went for a family member's Birthday, and the waitstaff did an excellent job-they even gave a very large slice of carrot cake for free! We will definitely be back.

Excellent place. Went on a Saturday night- busy, lively atmosphere but didn't feel crowded. Waiter was entertaining, very knowledgeable of menu and helped make some great selections. Brisket, pulled pork, chicken were all spot on. I would highly recommend the burnt brisket ends for an app. I personally ordered the shrimp and grits which was amazing if you want something a little different. Can't comment on drinks just ordered some beers.
Seems to have slipped a bit with some dishes since Whippen left.  Sad.

This place would be four stars if not for the price. Good barbecue, nice service and lovely surroundings. Bit pricey for average, though I suppose it's because of its location in the Gold Coast.

They have a giant chocolate cake here which was the highlight of the evening. One slice was the size of my face, and it was perfectly moist and chocolate-y.

pics.caption: Huge yummy moist chocolate cake with lots of fudge!

review.des: My friends and i came here for brunch and had an excellent experience! Their mimosa special was perfect, you got a bottle of champagne and carafe of OJ to share for $25 which was the perfect amount for 3 girls. They serve delicious bbq chips and pickles while you're waiting for your food. I ordered the omelette which was delicious as was the toast that came with it. Portions were very large. We weren't made aware that the omelet came with potatoes so i ordered potatoes on the side. Needless to say i had a ton of potatoes-it would've been nice to know that the meal came with that so i didn't order extra. Overall it was a lovely experience. The waitress and waiter that served us were very friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. Would definitely recommend again!

Attended a happy hour for FFC Gold Coast tonight. Only got to try a few apps because they were all getting grabbed before they got to our table (typical gym people taking all the food) but the fried green tomato was amazing. Also had the lemonade with house infused cucumber vodka which was also good. Husband said the old fashion was above average but not his favorite. We look forward to returning and trying more of the food.
